intro: Geonoma plicata, commonly known as the pleated fern, is a species of fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial plants. The plant is characterized by its intricate, pleated leaves that form a rosette shape, often with a waxy coating. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on trees or in forest understories. Its unique leaf structure helps it retain moisture, making it well adapted to its ecological niche.
